Description: Fragment of neck and part of rim of Attic black-figured pottery amphora. Inside has glazed band at top with added red line. Outside, two large rosettes preserved on neck with added red and white details. Lip glazed as far as preserved, with added red lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Hamilton College, Clinton (NY). This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0848)
